GClasses::GSparseMatrix

GClasses::GSparseMatrix Class Reference

This class simultaneously stores a row-compressed sparse matrix and a column-compressed sparse matrix. It updates both of them. More...

#include <GSparseMatrix.h>

List of all members.

 GSparseMatrix (unsigned int rows, unsigned int cols)
 ~GSparseMatrix ()
unsigned int rows ()
 Returns the number of rows (as if this matrix were dense).
unsigned int cols ()
 Returns the number of columns (as if this matrix were dense).
void print (std::ostream &stream)
 Prints in a text format to the specifed stream.
void save (const char *filename)
 Saves to the specified file.
void fullRow (double *pOutFullRow, unsigned int row)
 Copies a row into a non-sparse vector.
Iter rowBegin (unsigned int i)
 Returns a const_iterator to the beginning of a row. The iterator references a pair, such that first is the column, and second is the value.
Iter rowEnd (unsigned int i)
 Returns a const_iterator to the end of a row. The iterator references a pair, such that first is the column, and second is the value.
Iter colBegin (unsigned int i)
 Returns a const_iterator to the beginning of a column. The iterator references a pair, such that first is the row, and second is the value.
Iter colEnd (unsigned int i)
 Returns a const_iterator to the end of a column. The iterator references a pair, such that first is the row, and second is the value.
double get (unsigned int row, unsigned int col)
 Returns the value at the specified position in the matrix. Returns 0 if no element is stored at that position.
void set (unsigned int row, unsigned int col, double val)
 Sets a value at the specified position in the matrix. (Updates both copies of the matrix. If val is 0, it removes the element from both copies of the matrix.).
void copyFrom (GSparseMatrix *that)
 Copies values from "that" into "this". If the matrices are different sizes, any non-overlapping elements will be left at zero.
void copyFrom (GData *that)
 Copies values from "that" into "this". If the matrices are different sizes, any non-overlapping elements will be left at zero.
GData * toFullMatrix ()
 Converts to a full matrix.
void multiply (double scalar)
 Multiplies the matrix by a scalar value.
void swapColumns (unsigned int a, unsigned int b)
 Swaps the two specified columns.
void swapRows (unsigned int a, unsigned int b)
 Swaps the two specified rows.
void shuffle (GRand *pRand)
 Shuffles the rows in this matrix.
GSparseMatrix * subMatrix (int row, int col, int height, int width)
 Returns a sub-matrix of this matrix.
void transpose ()
 Transposes this matrix in place. (This operation is very efficient. It only needs to swap two pointers and two values.).
void singularValueDecomposition (GSparseMatrix **ppU, double **ppDiag, GSparseMatrix **ppV, int maxIters=30)
 This method is currently buggy. Don't use it until I remove this comment.

unsigned int m_rows

Map * m_pRows
Map * m_pCols

Detailed Description

This class simultaneously stores a row-compressed sparse matrix and a column-compressed sparse matrix. It updates both of them.
